intro: Erythrococca ulugurensis, commonly known as the Uluguru erythrococca, is a flowering plant native to the Uluguru Mountains in Tanzania. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and potential medicinal properties.
